title: Census Registration Service / Census Portal (Contract Extension, 2011-2012)
abstractText:
The Census Registration Service (CRS) and Census Portal provide centralised and cross-programme services and support for the ESRC Census of Population Programme and its users.

During 2011-12 the CRS, operated by the UK Data Archive, will continue to provide the programme’s online user registration service and single-sign-on access using federated access management (Shibboleth). This will maintain access to the data held by four of the units within the programme:

  1. Census Dissemination Unit
  2. UKBORDERS
  3. Centre for Interaction Data Estimation and Research
  4. Cathie Marsh Centre for Census and Survey Research.

The CRS will be a first stop helpdesk for users with queries about access to the programme’s resources.

The Portal will continue to be the central programme-branded access point for users. It will house the registration process; deliver information about the programme’s census data holdings, and will support dissemination of research via its data, publications and resources search facility. In addition to the units mentioned above this will support the work of the Centre for Longitudinal Study Information and User Support; the Longitudinal Studies Centre - Scotland, and the Northern Ireland Longitudinal Study - Research Support Unit.
